intro: Zabelia densipila, commonly known as the dense-leaved zabelia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in shrubland and woodland habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Its dense foliage and ability to thrive in arid conditions make it an important component of local ecosystems. Zabelia densipila is also valued for its ornamental qualities and traditional uses in some indigenous communities.
